title: Minchinhampton Common Walking Route

images.title: Brian Robert Marshall / Minchinhampton Common and some cattle, near Minchinhampton
images.caption: Cattle on the common in the summer of 2008. The common is protected by cattle grids at the main access points.

images.title: Brian Robert Marshall / Part of the road network, Minchinhampton Common, near Minchinhampton
images.caption: Part of the road network, Minchinhampton Common. The authorities have provided numerous parking areas making the common easily accessible to all. There is a 40 mph speed limit across the common to minimize the risk of motorists crashing into cattle.

images.title: Roger May / Minchinhampton Common in blossom
images.caption: Blossoms in the spring of 2006

images.title: Brian Robert Marshall / Minchinhampton Common, near Minchinhampton
images.caption: Nice views across the common's fields to the surrounding hills

images.title: Margaret Sutton / Market House, Minchinhampton
images.caption: Market House in the town of Minchinhampton. Built in 1698 for wool.

images.title: Chris Allen / Longfords Mills, Minchinhampton
images.caption: Longfords Mills, Minchinhampton. This was owned by William Playne and specialised in baize for snooker tables. Seen during conversion to dwellings. A water turbine and Belliss steam engine survive here.

description: This large area of common land near Nailsworth is criss-crossed with miles of nice footpaths. The common is also in an elevated position so there are great views of the surrounding Cotswold hills, countryside and villages. You'll reach a height of well over 600ft on the edge of the Cotswold Escarpment. On a clear day you can even see across the Severn Vale into Wales. It's also great for flora and fauna with skylarks and various orchids to look out for. This walk starts from the little village of Amberley on the western side of the common. From here you can pick up the footpaths leading towards Bownham, Burleigh and Box. To extend your walking in the area you can head to the nearby Rodborough Common. The common is located just to the north and consists of nearly 300 acres of attractive grassland, scrub and woodland. Also nearby is Selsley Common. It's located just to the west and has more nice paths and rare flora and fauna to discover. The common is located very close to the popular town of Stroud where you can enjoy a nice waterside walk along the Stroudwater Canal.
